tn.ref: Power is in the hand of their oppressors
tn.text: AT: "Their oppressors have great authority" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: but oppressed people have no comforter
tn.text: No one with authority is defending the oppressed.

tn.ref: more fortunate than both of them is the one who has not yet lived
tn.text: AT: "the one who has not yet been born is better off than both of them"

tn.ref: the envy of one's neighbor
tn.text: possible meanings are 1) The neighbor envy's the object his neighbor made or 2) the neighbor envy's the skills his neighbor has.

tn.ref: vapor and an attempt to shepherd the wind
tn.text: No one can control or direct the wind like they can animals. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ecc:01:12|1:14]].

tn.ref: folds his hands and does not work
tn.text: To fold the hands is a gesture of laziness and is another way of saying that the person refuses to work. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])

tn.ref: so his food is his own flesh
tn.text: AT: "as a result, he causes his own ruin." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: work that tries to shepherd the wind
tn.text: Not all work is profitable. Some work is not profitable like trying to control the wind. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: no son or brother
tn.text: This person has no family.

tn.ref: his eyes are not satisfied
tn.text: AT: "he is not satisfied" (See: [[: en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: For whom am I toiling and depriving myself of pleasure?
tn.text: AT: "Will anyone benefit from me working hard and not enjoying myself?" or "My work does not benefit anyone and I am not enjoying myself." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: If two lie down together, they can be warm
tn.text: The writer speaks of two people keeping each other warm on a cold night. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: how can one be warm alone?
tn.text: AT: "a person cannot be warm when he is alone." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: withstand an attack
tn.text: "defend themselves against an attack"

tn.ref: a three-strand rope is not quickly broken
tn.text: strand rope is not quickly broken** - AT: "people cannot easily break a rope made with three strands" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: he was born poor in his kingdom
tn.text: AT: "he was born to poor parents who lived in the land that he would someday rule"

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Instead of choosing the wise youth, the people choose the king's son who may not be any wiser.

tn.ref: alive and walking around
tn.text: The words "alive" and "walking around" mean basically the same thing and are combined for emphasis. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: There is no end to all the people
tn.text: AT: "There are very many people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])

tn.ref: vapor and an attempt to shepherd the wind
tn.text: See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ecc:01:12|1:14]].
